  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    org.lwjgl.opengl.GLCapabilities capabilities  
    int f_bottom
    sc_ is the dimensions of the window in screen coordinates, This is different than pixels since the positive of the y axis is inverted meaning it points down instead of up so the 0, 0 of the window is in the top left of the corner.
    int f_left
    sc_ is the dimensions of the window in screen coordinates, This is different than pixels since the positive of the y axis is inverted meaning it points down instead of up so the 0, 0 of the window is in the top left of the corner.

    sc_ is the dimensions of the window in screen coordinates, This is different than pixels since the positive of the y axis is inverted meaning it points down instead of up so the 0, 0 of the window is in the top left of the corner.

    org.lwjgl.glfw.GLFWFramebufferSizeCallback frmBffrClbk  
    boolean fullscreen  
    boolean maximized  
    boolean minimized  
    java.lang.String name
    The name is what the engine recognizes and it is used to find the window.
    float opacity
    GLFW Supports whole window transparency, but only if the system supports it as well.
    int p_height
    sc_ is the dimensions of the window in screen coordinates, This is different than pixels since the positive of the y axis is inverted meaning it points down instead of up so the 0, 0 of the window is in the top left of the corner.
    int p_width
    sc_ is the dimensions of the window in screen coordinates, This is different than pixels since the positive of the y axis is inverted meaning it points down instead of up so the 0, 0 of the window is in the top left of the corner.
    Vector2i position
    Position of the window in screen coordinates (the top left of the window)
